item.title: Arm will be @ PyTorch Conference, Join Us!
item.description: Arm will be @ PyTorch Conference, Join Us! Join us on site October 22-23 to see how Arm empowers developers to build and deploy AI applications with ease using PyTorch and ExecuTorch. Learn about the latest AI technologies from Arm and our ecosystem while expanding your professional network alongside like-minded AI engineers. Learn more here: https://huggingface.co/blog/Arm/arm-at-pytorch-conference See translation

item.title: Benchmarking xLLM and Specialized Language Models: New Approach & Results
item.description: Benchmarking xLLM and Specialized Language Models: New Approach & Results https://mltblog.com/4nzaKUb Standard benchmarking techniques using LLM as a judge have strong limitations. First it creates a circular loop and reflects the flaws present in the AI judges. Then, the perceived quality depends on the end user: an enterprise LLM appeals to professionals and business people, while a generic one appeals to laymen. The two have almost opposite criteria to assess the value. Finally, benchmarking metrics currently in use fail to capture many of the unique features of specialized LLMs, such as exhaustivity, or the quality of the relevancy and trustworthiness scores attached to each element in the response. In fact, besides xLLM, very few if any LLMs display such scores to the user. I now discuss these points, as well as the choice of test prompts, and preliminary results about xLLM, compared to others. -- Structured output vs standard response -- A peculiarity of xLLM is that if offers...

item.title: Super nice intro to fine-tuning with TRL, just dropped by

They use SFT + QLoRA to fine-tune the tiny Gemma 3 270M model for emoji generation Hereâ€™s what the fine-tuned model generates for the prompt: â€œI'm learning to tweetâ€ â†’ ğŸ¦ğŸ—£ğŸ’» Colab: https://colab.research.google.com/github/google-gemini/gemma-cookbook/blob/main/Demos/Emoji-Gemma-on-Web/resources/Fine_tune_Gemma_3_270M_for_emoji_generation.ipynb Try it out: google/emoji-gemma Learn more: https://developers.googleblog.com/en/own-your-ai-fine-tune-gemma-3-270m-for-on-device/ See translation

item.title: âœ… New Article: *Envy â€” The Structural Law of Relative Evaluation*
item.description: âœ… New Article: *Envy â€” The Structural Law of Relative Evaluation* Title: ğŸ§­ Envy, Comparison, and the Structural Law of Relative Evaluation: Why â€œThey Got Moreâ€ Hurts â€” and How Protocols Contain It ğŸ”— https://huggingface.co/blog/kanaria007/envy-structural-law-of-relative-evaluation --- Summary: Envy isnâ€™t a moral glitch â€” itâ€™s a *relative-evaluation loop*. When identity meets comparison, the mind computes *delta-to-others* (status, attention, resources). If that delta breaches a threshold without a repair path, the loop escalates into resentment. Structured Intelligence makes this computable â€” and containable. > Envy compares levels. > *Integrity compares trajectories.* --- Why It Matters: â€¢ Turns envy from shame into an *auditable signal* (where, when, and why comparison spikes) â€¢ Provides *de-escalation protocols* for individuals, teams, and platforms â€¢ Guides product/organization design to reduce perceived unfairness and burnout --- Whatâ€™s Inside: â€¢ The Envy Loop: *trigger â†’...
